website_summaries.verdict: All-aluminum construction in this ramp with a solid plate surface, making it easier to roll the dirt bike up the ramp.
pros: With its flat-plate design, the bike moves more smoothly up the ramp versus a model with thicker crossbars in the design
Has a few grooves and holes in the plate, so it will give you a bit of traction to avoid wheel slippage
Nice width at 11.3 inches and weight of 19 pounds
cons: Not going to support larger dirt bikes very well, as plates may bend

customer_reviews.title: These are great ramps - especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: These are great ramps - especially for the price. They weigh only 19 pounds each and fold to only 46" so they fit easily in the bed or cab of any truck. I used them for loading and unloading my Honda CRF450R, and Suzuki DR650. The ramps handled both bikes with ease. I bought 2 so I can walk up one while rolling the bike up the other. The flat plate design is much safer and easier to walk on than crossbars. It provides excellent traction for tires and shoes. The ramp being arched along with the flat plate design results in smooth loading and less effort needed to push the bike up the ramp.
customer_reviews.author: Retired in Colorado

customer_reviews.title: Look around, there's better designs available for the same price.
customer_reviews.text: Returned the item because the aluminum plates bent easily and the scalloped cutouts in the ramp provided little grip. Bike would slide backwards very easily. There are better designs out there for the same price (like the one with rods going across rather than plates).
customer_reviews.author: P. Lamoureux

customer_reviews.title: Wide, long and easy to load with
customer_reviews.text: This ramps sweet. I have a little 2 inch lift on my truck that I had been using a 6' to load with, making it a bit tricky with wet tires or a wet bed liner. This thing is just great. What I've noticed. The welds are clean and strong and there doesn't seem to be any bowing when loading a 275 pound bike. The way they built the hinge has one section sitting on a big piece of aluminum. I don't think it will ever bend the wrong way when loading. -This was my major concern when purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Best

It was properly packaged and although the user instructions weren't exactly for this ramp, it was easy enough to set up the strap for securing the ramp to your pickup. The ramp pivot bolts are a nut with a cotter pin. The cotter pin was oversized, so I trimmed it down to make it safer, but other than that, the ramp operated and installed easily. customer_reviews.title: A great ramp at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: I don't use this ramp for off road bikes, but I'm sure it is perfect for any two wheeler you need to get in the truck. The arc is perfect for even most cruisers that might drag bottom on a straight ramp. I've seen too many guys try to load up road bikes without considering that factor till it's too late and they are left at the tailgate with the bike in the worst possible position and bottomed out at the top of a straight ramp. Look at Youtube for examples. This is well made and compact so I can keep it in my truck just in case. A great ramp at a great price.

product_meta.title: Black Widow AFP-9012 Single Runner Motorcycle Ramp – Finger-Style Lip, Plate Surface
product_meta.description:
Manufactured from highest-strength, lightweight aluminum, this folding motocross ramp has a 750 lb. weight capacity and is the ultimate combination of strength and convenience. Arched for maximum clearance, this plate-style dirt bike ramp features a heavy-duty hinge system that allows the ramp to be folded in half for compact storage and transportability. A high-traction surface with raised ribs provides excellent grip in any weather condition, making the loading process as safe as possible. This ramp is held in place by a set of rubber-coated fingers that grip the tailgate without scratching and an included adjustable safety strap.

We recommend always working with at least two people when using single-runner ramps for loading. These aluminum motocross ramps are not intended for riding your bike up because they are not wide enough to put your feet down when loading and unloading.
feature_bullets: Folding single-runner ramp for loading and unloading motorcycles, dirt bikes, and more
High-traction plate-style surface with an arched design for maximum engine and tailpipe clearance
Rubber-coated finger-style attaching points support ramp on vehicle without scratching paint
Manufactured from lightweight aluminum with a 750 lb. weight capacity
Measures 7' 5-1/4" L x 11-1/8" W and folds in half for easy transport and storage
